docs.snippet: China has heightened its campaign to reduce Taiwan’s presence on the world stage, but President Tsai Ing-wen is trying to use the service to overcome that isolation.

headline.print_headline: Muffled by China, Taiwan’s President Employs Twitter as Megaphone
headline.main: Muffled by China, Taiwan President Embraces Twitter as Megaphone

docs.snippet: Britons are quick to show their “Keep Calm and Carry On” spirit. But after yet another attack, a new unease is palpable.

headline.print_headline: Against Terror, Is London Pride Enough?
headline.main: Against Terror, Is London Pride Enough?

docs.snippet: Many government officials have called to remove dozens of controversial statues, markers and other monuments from public grounds.

headline.main: Confederate Monuments Are Coming Down Across the United States. Here’s a List.

docs.snippet: Wednesday: Allergy-friendly bars, a female police officer is shot dead in the Bronx, and remembering a jazz great.
The Mayweather-McGregor bout and N.B.A. free agency call into question the structure of labor and compensation in American professional sports.

headline.print_headline: Should Superstar Athletes Make More Money and Run Their Leagues?
headline.main: Should Superstar Athletes Make More Money and Run Their Leagues?

docs.snippet: In this week’s Australia Letter, we visit Lismore, a small town ravaged by a surging river. Plus: Lisa Pryor, and a Japanese cafe in the Byron hinterlands.

headline.print_headline: Rural Resilience After a Devastating Flood
headline.main: Rural Resilience After a Devastating Flood

docs.snippet: Mr. Mulvaney, the White House budget director, said his desire to eliminate wasteful spending was formed in childhood.

headline.print_headline: From Saving Ketchup Packets to Setting the Budget
headline.main: Mick Mulvaney on the Budget, Congressional Scorekeepers and Staying Frugal

docs.snippet: Prepare with recipes for the grill, the stovetop and the oven.
Martin Walker shares the wines and food of the Périgord region, which inspired the fictional world of Bruno Courrèges, his small-town French police chief.

headline.main: The Delicious World of Bruno, Chief of Police

docs.snippet: “Nevertheless” debuts at No. 5 on the hardcover nonfiction best-seller list.

headline.main: Alec Baldwin Settles Scores in New Memoir
